ygData.subject: Re: RE: Why bother with pottery?
ygData.msgSnippet: Aye, sadly I have to agree with you. I busted my hump to be one of the first to figure out the ever elusive vial recipes. Found it, made them and guess
ygData.messageBody:
Aye, sadly I have to agree with you. I busted my hump to be one of the
first to figure out the 'ever elusive' vial recipes. Found it, made them
and guess what....there they sit in my bank collecting dust. Many rogues
don't even know the recipes for poison on my server therefore rendering the
vials pointless. The ones who do either hopped on pottery quickly and can
make their own vials (great! ;/) or as you said have bought them cheaply
from other places. (now I know WHERE!!!) I can understand verant wishing to
change pottery so that ppl couldn't walk away with 1000 plat in a day
...however their desire to make it a "player based economy" for potters is
absolutely NIL!!! There is not a damn thing I can sell to ANY player which
they can't either buy cheaper from a damn merchant somewhere or which they
can't take a bit of money and an hour or two and work on their own pottery
and become self sufficient. So much for this trade skill!!! It has been
totally spun into the ground now. *sighs* Ah well...I enjoyed the skill
while it lasted..time to move on to something else I guess.

At 04:12 AM 8/14/99 -0500, you wrote:
>From: "Bonecrkr" <bonecrkr@...>
>
>> What vendor, where??? Another potter may have sold the vials to
>> the vendor,
>> but I do not think that there is a vendor who sells these on a regular
>> basis!!!
>>
>> I have been making/selling 100's of poison vials to the small rogue
>> community on my server (to see how small on yours type /who all rogue 20
>> 50), and doubling my investment (on supplies) with every sale.
>
>This is not the case. They have all the vials and always have the vials
>every time I check. They are cheap and easy to find. The case with the
>rogues simply doesn't exist on my server. The results of my attempt to sell
>vials ranged from grim amusement to outright antagonsim. This could change
>but I highly doubt it once the word gets out about the vendors (at least in
>Freeport marketplace). I WISH the market for it was on E. Marr but it
>ain't. I have also complained bitterly about the vials in Freeport (perhaps
>a market could develop). The silence has been deafening.
>
